name: You need to confirm your joint application (applied but not awarded HWF)
body:
Dear ((first name)) ((last name))

Your ((partner)) reviewed the information you entered and provided some of their own information. Now you need to confirm and pay for your joint application.  

Your ((partner)) did not apply for 'Help With Fees' and so help with fees cannot be claimed on this application.

Confirm and pay for your joint application: ((signin url)) 

Your application will not be submitted until you have paid for it.

#If you cannot pay 
The payment system will only allow you to pay but you could talk to your ((partner)) about whether they would be prepared to send you some money. 

Or you could submit a sole application. If you apply as a sole applicant, only you have to apply and be eligible for Help With Fees. 

If you create a sole application, you will not have to re-enter the information you have already provided. You will need to provide some new information though. 

You will be asked whether you want to continue and pay or apply as a sole applicant, when you sign in. 

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email
subject: Action required: you need to confirm and pay for your joint ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership))
